definition: to act in a play/to put on a play

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance

sentences.english: It was, instead, an example of Chinese stagecraft.
sentences.chinese: 這次對話是中國式做戲的一個典範。

sentences.english: Watching closely, you will have a feeling that she is acting.
sentences.chinese: 留心觀察一下，你會感覺到她是在做戲。

sentences.english: The young man, striking a theatrical attitude, read aloud a poem by Shakespeare.
sentences.chinese: 那個年輕人做戲似地朗讀了莎士比亞的一首詩。

sentences.english: Why own act in a play for oneself and they looks?
sentences.chinese: 何必自己做戲給自己和他們看呢？

sentences.english: He was Jaime, and you were just some girl who'd played a part.
sentences.chinese: 他是詹姆，而你只是個做戲的女孩。

definition: shameful/scandalous/to be humiliated/to make a fool of sb or oneself/to make sb lose face
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
to work hard/to do one's very best/to throw oneself into the task at hand
unceasing torrent (idiom)/talking non-stop/gabbling forty to the dozen
to attend a lecture/to listen to a talk
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
troublesome/to take a lot of trouble to do sth
